docs.snippet: There was a showdown in Houston last fall. This spring, North Carolina became the battleground. By now, confrontations have flared across the country over whether to protect or curtail the right of transgender people to use public restrooms in acc...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a showdown in Houston last fall. This spring, North Carolina became the battleground. By now, confrontations have flared across the country over whether to protect or curtail the right of transgender people to use public restrooms in accordance with their gender identity.

headline.main: Debate Over Transgender Bathroom Access Spreads Nationwide

docs.snippet: The attack on my neighborhood in November 2015 didn’t put an end to my time as an expat in France. It gave me a fuller view of the place I call home....
docs.lead_paragraph: The attack on my neighborhood in November 2015 didn’t put an end to my time as an expat in France. It gave me a fuller view of the place I call home.
docs.abstract: Seth Sherwood travel essay celebrates resilience of his neighborhood, 11th Arrondissement of Paris, which has found its stability again following slow recovery from 2015 terrorist attacks; holds traveling around Europe should not stop anyone seeking adventure, given vast territory of continent in which life has remained routine and comforting.

headline.main: Spring in Paris, My Adopted City, After the Attacks
headline.print_headline: Onward in Paris  as Spring Returns
